main event: An F86 pilot reported observing a light resembling a star moving from east to west over Knoxville, Tennessee on 19 October 1955.
interesting points: The pilot was unable to close in on the object due to its speed., The object changed color during the observation., The observation lasted approximately 2 to 3 minutes., After the visual observation, contact was made with the object on airborne radar, but the pilot could not close the distance., The weather conditions were clear, allowing for a good view.
sighted object: a light resembling a star, orange in color
location: 30 mi NW of Knoxville, Tennessee, USA
witness description: F86 pilot from the 354th Fighter Interceptor Squadron
